title: betaras.nft
author: betaras.nft
content: Greetings, my name is Betaras, I am a digital artist and a fresh NFT Project, creator. At a recent moment, I run a fundraising sale of my art but have had no volume so far.I would like to ask what forum members can suggest to me, is it any non-paid, fast method to gain more revenue?I'm expecting some major responses.Thanks in advanceBTCtwitter: @betaras_nft

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: You may want to have a look at the collectibles  section of the forum https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=217.0Here is the place to sell Bitcoin related art. Some Bitcoin goods can also be sold with accompanying NFTs. It’s worth having a good look through the threads and see if it’s something worth your while .Hope this helps

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: betaras.nft on August 03, 2022, 10:39:00 AMI would like to ask what forum members can suggest to me, is it any non-paid, fast method to gain more revenue?I'm expecting some major responses.Don't know if this applies as a major response, but you should consider learning about digital marketing this would guide you in building interaction with people who could eventually turn to customers:• Read about what platforms are best for promoting your project, do not be limited to just Twitter,• Create a compelling funnel like profile, which would draw readers of your posts in and maybe turn them to be part of your community,• Interact: this is very important. To connect with people (relevant to that field) you have to interact with them, involves liking, commenting, private messaging etcNOTE: do not spam• Be consistent with your engagements,• Provide value beyond your art, there are a thousand and one arts out there, try to stand out with other helpful content,• Remain consistent,• Constantly read and learn about building an online presence.Alternatively, you could always hire a social media manager.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: I am not sure I understand you completely. Are you only looking for a place to sell your digital artwork to raise funds, or are you also searching for a way to advertise your services? If you are also looking to promote your services to this community, the Services section is the best place to do that. But you have to accept Bitcoin as a requirement to advertise in the services board. Feel free to browse through it a bit to see how other users are promoting themselves. However, that is not the place to sell your digital artwork. Mbitr provided you with the correct location.

comments.author: betaras.nft
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on August 03, 2022, 11:11:20 AMI am not sure I understand you completely. Are you only looking for a place to sell your digital artwork to raise funds, or are you also searching for a way to advertise your services? If you are also looking to promote your services to this community, the Services section is the best place to do that. But you have to accept Bitcoin as a requirement to advertise in the services board. Feel free to browse through it a bit to see how other users are promoting themselves. However, that is not the place to sell your digital artwork. Mbitr provided you with the correct location. Thanks for reply

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: The answer is quite simple. You still need to learn marketing of your project. Yes you indeed have talent for the nft however, not all nft me succesful cause we made one. What you need is traction and seeing there is no revenue sales, is probably due to lack of creativity or uniqueness? Dont get me wrong. Nft is great, but the taste of the community should be seen from the activity of those nft on the market. Its not too late, can still do a lot of things to make others noticed it.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Seeing your artworks in Twitter, I am afraid that a classical/abstract approach wouldn't get much traction in public as opposed to a digitally/3d modelled artworks which can be enhanced using various computer software. I am an artist as well and from what I have experienced, modern looking NFT's are far more marketable than those traditionally looking NFT's arts. When I say modern, these are NFT's that is created using 3d modelling software such as blender, autodesk, fusion and what not. And I know the artscene in cryptospace sucks especially when you are not as popular as Beeple or else you can't make any sale even if you have a genuine motive.You just have to admit that the NFT space won't be profitable if you are a one man team, no partnership to major companies, working product, and modern looking artworks.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: As pointed out by @Maus0728 above that you are into competitive market of NFT and you have only 34 twitter followers and you would need marketing strategies to sell out your work which I am afraid is hard to do so.If you see from forum perspective then there's a collectibles section where you can see lot of members are interested in buying physical stuff that can be transferred to them via shipment but don't think so your NFT sale would happen there but still you can try out there.Or the other way is you can ask for help by reaching out members that can help your project grow but they will be paid service.You see there are really good artwork projects out there that are not able to sell without reaching the target audience so how do you think your artwork would sell easily.See don't get me wrong and I appreciate your efforts but if we are seeking fund raise then we also need to look at all the aspects like art improvement, marketing and what utility will it offer to the holders.So make sure you make some plans accordingly and then try to sell your artwork.One advice is you will get lot of people on twitter so make contact with them and your target audience is also there so reach them out.

comments.author: masulum
comments.body: Selling NFT is indeed quite difficult at the moment, especially if we don't have an active community network of holders or buyers for NFT, whether art, meme, or P2E. If you want to do fundraising, try making an announcement in this forum, and don't forget to be active on twitter/other social media, or, if you already have an NFT that ready to sell, you have to try to offering it on the marketplace board. This is the best way if you don't want to spend money on marketing for your project. Then, you should have more explanation about the value of the NFT/project you offer. Because with value, maybe you will find quality prospects for your project. Wll, to be honest, without network, you will hard to get customer except you are doing an airdrop with your NFTs or any giveaway. Sometimes, from doing this, you will find a customers.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: I don't think there's other solution except improve your drawing skills or have enough reputation/popularity.The reason why some NFT sold for high price is their drawing is good enough or the creator is an artist, though there's could be a manipulation where he's using his another address to bought his own NFT, so he send his money from his address to another.

comments.author: betaras.nft
comments.body: Quote from: Solosanz on August 04, 2022, 03:22:39 PMI don't think there's other solution except improve your drawing skills or have enough reputation/popularity.The reason why some NFT sold for high price is their drawing is good enough or the creator is an artist, though there's could be a manipulation where he's using his another address to bought his own NFT, so he send his money from his address to another.Worth to mention, that the NFT market is highly manipulative, but art, especially 1/1 listed on specififc marketplace is completely other thing, place to sell helps to find target audience and I have problem finding itAt least I think so.Thanks for reply

comments.author: pawa2
comments.body: How to become member from Newbie or path to get merit

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: betaras.nft on August 03, 2022, 10:39:00 AMGreetings, my name is Betaras, I am a digital artist and a fresh NFT Project, creator. At a recent moment, I run a fundraising sale of my art but have had no volume so far.I would like to ask what forum members can suggest to me, is it any non-paid, fast method to gain more revenue?I'm expecting some major responses.Thanks in advanceBTCtwitter: @betaras_nftMaybe the best option you can get is to increase your reputation first by flexing up your portfolio on any social media channels. You can start up creating facebook page where you can post your artworks for free so that you can get the attention of the collectors then follow your daily activity.If you get tons of supporters then maybe that's the best time to sell out your arts by making it as an NFT.  since going to early without having a good background will make you struggle to find some investors on your project.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: betaras.nft on August 03, 2022, 10:39:00 AMSnippedLet me start by saying you don't need to bold all your writings before we can see or understand the message you want to pass across, and regarding your NFT art works, you need to work on improving yourself, quite alright there's alot of demand in it and people are making it through that, but what you need to know is how are they making this progress? Your art must be unique, marketable, then you must know how to engage with clients for the marketing, it requires time and quality efforts altogether to arrived with a good result.

comments.author: Laurendaldin
comments.body: I realized a long time ago that to make good money on art, it's not enough just to be a good artist. You also need to know how to sell. I can advise you to study the features of digital marketing (the Skillshare platform can help with it - an inexpensive subscription opens access to all courses), expand the number of social media for promotion, and look for advertising opportunities from bloggers relevant to the topic
